question: When teaching a client about contraception, which of the following would NURSE include as the MOST effective method for preventing sexually transmitted infections?
Dilation of the cervix continuous from 4 to 7 cm, contractions become stronger, more frequent, longer and more painful is termed as:
The cardinal movements/mechanism of labor is which of the following sequence?
options: engagement, descent, flexion, external rotation, extension, internal rotation and expulsion
engagement, descent, flexion, internal rotation, extension, external rotation and expulsion
engagement, internal rotation, flexion, descent, extension, external rotation and expulsion
engagement, flexion, descent, internal rotation, extension, external rotation and expulsion
answer: engagement, descent, flexion, internal rotation, extension, external rotation and expulsion

question: Which of the following kinds of spontaneous abortion occur complete expulsion of all products of conception:

Immediately after external rotation, which of the following cardinal/mechanisms of normal labor occur?
Triangular in shaped, normally closes by the end of age 2 months, junction of parietal bones and occipital bones is termed as:
Which of the following complications of pregnancy describes the implantation of products of conception in a site other than endometrium or outside the uterine cavity:

All of the following are the common clinical manifestations of ectopic pregnancy, EXCEPT:
options: sharp abdominal pain referred to shoulder pain
weight loss, excessive nausea and vomiting
answer: weight loss, excessive nausea and vomiting

question: Tonic and clonic convulsions, renal shutdown, coma. Oliguria and anuria are signs and symptoms of which of the following complications of pregnancy:

options: Concealed or external dark red discharge

question: According to Reva Rubin in her classic work on maternal behavior, in which phase would the new mother typically passive, dependent, and frequently review her labor and delivery experience?

Trisha Mae, 17-year-old came to the clinic for a birth control method. She sat through the class that describes the methods available to her. After class, she asked Ms. Paulette the NURSE, “Anong paraan o method kaya ang pinakamabuti para sa akin?” The best response by Ms. Paulette is:
options: You are so young Trisha, are you sure you are ready for the responsibilities of a sexual relationship?
Because of your age, we need your parents’ consent before you can be examined and then we’ll talk
Before I can help you with that "question", I need to know your sexual activity.
I cannot advice you Trisha because you are too young to be interested with that kind of methods.
answer: Before I can help you with that "question", I need to know your sexual activity.

question: The therapeutic management for incompetent cervix is which of the following surgical procedure?
The sign and symptoms of abruptio placenta include which of the following:
options: FHR stable and within normal limits

options: Look for the presence of the umbilical cord at the vaginal orifice
Note the color and consistency of the amniotic fluid

question: All but one are the causes and predisposing factors of uterine rupture:

The following noted appearance is completely pink, heart rate is 126, coughing and sneezing, with some flexion of extremities, and slow weak cry. Which of the following Apgar score and points status is correct:
All but one are the signs and symptoms of spontaneous abortion:
Epigastric pain, cerebral or visual disturbances, persistent vomiting, high blood pressure (160/100mmHg) are signs and symptoms of which of the following:

According to Sigmund Freud Psychosexual Theory the center of gratification is in the mouth;
The third stage of labor begins with delivery of the newborn and ends with:
options: the expulsion of the umbilical cord
the cervix is completely effaced & dilated

question: The second stage of labor begins with complete dilation of the cervix and ends with:
options: the expulsion of the umbilical cord
the cervix is completely effaced & dilated

question: In addition to changing the mother’s position, what other independent nursing intervention is indicated when the umbilical cord is prolapsed out of the vagina?
options: Wash the cord immediately with warm antiseptic solution and replace it into the vagina
Cover the cord with a wet sterile sponge
Keep the cord warm and moist with continuous application of warm sterile saline compress
Apply clamp to the exposed cord and cover with sterile water
answer: Keep the cord warm and moist with continuous application of warm sterile saline compress

question: During which stage of labor does “crowning” occur?
All but one are the best position for the patient suffering from prolapsed of umbilical cord to reduce pressure on cord:
If a client experiences a ruptured ectopic pregnancy, an expected signs and symptoms would be:
options: Sudden excruciating pain in the lower abdomen
answer: Sudden excruciating pain in the lower abdomen

question: Mrs. Brooke Shields visited the maternity clinic and asked the NURSE on duty about her ovulation period, her LMP was started last month, May 25, 2024 (28 – 29 day cycle). What would be the ovulation period of Mrs. Shields?
The NURSE understanding the action of Hydralazine is;

Manang Pacing is in her 36th week of pregnancy is admitted to the maternity unit in an effort to control the further development of eclampsia. She is assigned to a private room. The best rationale for this room assignment is:
options: The client is financially able to afford it
The client would be disturbed if placed in a room where another mother was in active labor
A quiet, darkened room is important to reduce external stimuli
A rigid regimen is an important aspect of eclamptic care
answer: A quiet, darkened room is important to reduce external stimuli

question: After doing the Leopold’s maneuvers on a pregnant client, the NURSE determines that the fetus is in cephalic presentation, back is palpated on the left side. To best auscultate the fetal heart tones (FHT), the Doppler is placed on the:
When performing a newborn assessment, the NURSE should measure the vital signs in the following sequence:
The fetus is most likely to structurally damaged by the pregnant woman’s ingestion of drugs during the:
Induction of labor is defined as the deliberate initiation of uterine contractions which is indicated for the following:
All but one are criteria for induction of labor:
options: With a history of pregnancy, induced hypertension (Eclampsia)
answer: With a history of pregnancy, induced hypertension (Eclampsia)

question: Which of the following factors is the underlying cause of dystocia?
Instructing the client about her nutritional needs during pregnancy, Miss Santos the NURSE on duty tells her that she will have an increase need for:

In the Delivery Room (DR) a client has just delivered a healthy 7-pound baby boy. The physician instructs Mr. Michael Reyes the NURSE on duty to suction the baby. The procedure the nurse would use is to:
options: turn the baby on his side so mucous will drain out before suctioning
suction nose first then the mouth continuously until the physician gives further instructions

question: The term dizygotic refers to twins who have:
options: Development in one amnion and one chorion
Development physically at different rates from each other
Been born several hours apart from each other
Development from two ova and two sperms
answer: Development from two ova and two sperms

question: Which of the following complications of pregnancy refer to the difficult, painful, prolonged labor due to mechanical factors?
Which of the following is the primary predisposing factor related to mastitis?
options: Epidemic infection from nosocomial sources localizing in the lactiferous glands and ducts
Temporary urinary retention due to decreased perception of the urge to void
Breast injury caused by over distention, stasis, abscess formation in the glandular tissue and cracking of the nipples
Inflation of the vascular endothelium with cloth formation
answer: Breast injury caused by over distention, stasis, abscess formation in the glandular tissue and cracking of the nipples

question: Pituitary hormone that stimulates the secretion of milk from the mammary glands is:

When attending the pre natal clinic, a newly pregnant client, having her first child, express concern about her “dark nipples” and a “dark line” from her navel to the pubis. The MIDWIFE explains that these adaptations are due to increased level of:
The primary clinical observation for APGAR scoring is the:
It is a diamond shaped, normally closes age 12 to 18 months, junction of the two parietal bones and two fused fontal bones is termed as:
During woman’s labor, the NURSE must be alert for life-threatening umbilical cord prolapsed, especially:
options: During the second stage of labor
When the presenting part is not engaged in the pelvic brim
If the amniotic sac is intact
answer: When the presenting part is not engaged in the pelvic brim

question: The following are the purpose/rationale of episiotomy, EXCEPT:
options: Heals more easily than a laceration
Surgical incision reduces possibility of laceration
Protects infant’s head from pressure exerted by resistant perineum

question: Mrs. Demi Moore asked Miss Phoebe the NURSE about her ovulation period. She said that her LMP was last May 15, 2024 (28 to 30 day cycle). What would be the ovulation period of Mrs. Demi Moore?
Homan’s sign is pain elicited by flexion of foot with knee extended is a common clinical manifestation of which of the following:
Aling Cora has just given birth to a stillborn with congenital deformities. She knows this but says, “Gusto kong Makita ang baby ko please”. What is the NURSE’s best approach?
options: That’s alright . I’ll bring the baby to you as per doctor advice
It would be better to let your husband see the baby; then he can tell you
Are you really sure you want to? You might regret it later.
Lets talk about it first. Tell me Aling Cora what you expect with your baby?
answer: Lets talk about it first. Tell me Aling Cora what you expect with your baby?

question: Aling Lucing, primagravida, 32-year-old, delivered an 8 lb. 5 oz. baby girl by cesarian section. Which of the following actions would NOT be included in the client’s immediate postoperative care?
options: Taking vital signs q15min for 2 to 3 hours
Checking lochia for amount and color q15min for 2 to 3 hours
Assisting the client to turn, cough and deep breathe
Offering oral fluids q15min for 2 to 3 hours
answer: Offering oral fluids q15min for 2 to 3 hours

question: A newly pregnant client who is a little overweight asks the NURSE how much weight she should gain over the 9 months. The most appropriate answer by the nurse is:
options: For your size, a little heavy, about 15 pounds would be best.
It really doesn’t matter exactly how much weight you gain, as long as your diet is healthy
A gain of about 24-30 pounds is best for mother and baby
A gain of about 24-30 pounds is best for mother and baby.
answer: A gain of about 24-30 pounds is best for mother and baby

question: On a first visit, a client asks Mr. Red the NURSE on duty, “Totoo ba na e-eksaminin (internal examination) ako ni doctor ngayon?” The nurse should respond:
options: Yes. Have you ever had an internal examination done before?
Are you fearful of having internal examination done?
Yes. An internal examination is done to all mothers, but it is only slightly uncomfortable.
No. It’s up to you to decide. Are you afraid now? So we can re-schedule the examination.
answer: Yes. An internal examination is done to all mothers, but it is only slightly uncomfortable.

question: During delivery Dr. Suarez performs an episiotomy. Miss Aquino the NURSE on duty reminds the client that this is most commonly done to:

During postpartum period, Rubio the NURSE on duty examines the client and identifies the presence of lochia serosa and feels the fundus four fingerbreadths below the umbilicus. This indicates that the time elapsed is:
